column2: OKLAHOMA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Oklahoma
column6: OK

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column6: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column8: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column10: make alcohol the focus of the event.

column2: 2. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: avoid drinking coffee.
column6: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column8: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column10: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

column2: 3. Large trucks:
column4: can stop quicker than passenger vehicles.
column6: have large blind spots.
column8: do not need more room to maneuver.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 4. When parallel parking between two cars, you should first:
column4: back slowly.
column6: turn your wheels to the left.
column8: turn your wheels to the right.
column10: pull up even with the front car.

column2: 5. The sign in the picture:
column4: is a warning sign.
column6: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column8: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column10: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 6. When you drive into the street from any driveway you:
column4: can disregard pedestrians if there is no sidewalk.
column6: must honk the horn so approaching vehicles and pedestrians can allow you room.
column8: must drive slowly so approaching vehicles and pedestrians can get out of your way.
column10: must stop and proceed only when there are no pedestrians or vehicles approaching.

column2: 7. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column6: race on empty roads.
column8: share the lane with another vehicle.
column10: ride side-by-side in a single lane.

column2: 8. Blind spots are:
column4: areas of the road that cannot be seen even when looking into mirrors.
column6: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that are easy to spot.
column8: traffic control devices.

column2: 9. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column4: Warning signs (diamond)
column6: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)
column8: Guide signs (horizontal rectangle)
column10: Warning signs (diamond)

column2: 10. Blocking an intersection during rush hour traffic is not permitted:
column4: under any circumstances.
column6: unless you have the right-of-way.
column8: unless you entered the intersection on a green light.

column2: 11. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car approaching from the left.
column6: The car approaching from the right.
column8: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column10: The car that is traveling faster.

column2: 12. Green and white signs:
column4: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column6: give information about directions and distances.
column8: direct drivers to services.
column10: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.

column2: 13. When driving at night, if an approaching car is using its high-beams you should:
column4: look toward the left edge of the road.
column6: look toward the right edge of the road.
column8: turn your lights on and off.

column2: 14. This sign means:
column4: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column6: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 15. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column6: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column8: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column10: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.

column2: 16. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.
column6: the type of route you are on.
column8: the speed limit on that route.
column10: that the route you are on might be dangerous.

column2: 17. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column6: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column8: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column10: they must stop immediately.

column2: 18. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column6: Rounabout ahead.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column10: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Pedestrians must not cross here
column6: Pedestrian crossing ahead
column8: Pedestrians walking along the road ahead
column10: School zone ahead

column2: 20. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column8: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column10: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

column2: 21. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and then stop.
column6: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column8: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column10: wait for the next green light.

column2: 22. Drivers approaching a stopped school bus with flashing amber lights should always:
column4: speed up and pass quickly.
column6: None of the other answers is correct.
column8: slow down and prepare to stop.
column10: blow their horn and pass slowly.

column2: 23. Tailgating:
column4: is a defensive driving tecnique.
column6: helps reduce traffic congestion.
column8: cannot result in a traffic citation.
column10: can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.

column2: 24. A traffic light shows both a red light and a green arrow. The driver may not turn in the direction of the arrow until the red light has changed.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 25. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column8: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.
column10: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
